title: Security Guard II - Chino, CA (Part-time)
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a part-time armed Security Guard in our Chino, CA facility. The Security Guard will help maintain the safety and security of the In-N-Out Burger warehouse and distribution facility in Chino.  

General Responsibilities:
  • Maintain the safety and security of the Chino warehouse and distribution center 
  • Understand all aspects of guard monitoring, such as operating the lobby, foot patrols, monitoring the cameras, understanding the alarm system and emergency procedures
  • Serve as a receptionist/greeter in the lobby for all visitors coming to the facility
  • Screen and log in all visitors entering and exiting the complex
  • Conduct routine surveillance; perform security patrols, protocol and contingency operations
  • Contacts law enforcement or fire department in case of an emergency
  • After business hours - checks doors, windows, to ensure the property is secure
  • Investigates reports of suspicious activity on the property
  • Provide excellent customer service; maintain friendliness and professionalism at all times
  • Possess good judgment to handle day to day operations
  • Perform all duties with pride; Work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation

Work Schedule:
  • Part-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • 2 shifts (16 hours total) per week; potential to pick up more shifts as needed 
  • Shifts are:
    • Saturday:  9:30pm - 6:00am
    • Sunday:  9:30pm - 6:00am
  • Weekend and holiday availability required 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range is $27.16-$31.25 per hour                   
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications:
  • Valid California Driver’s License; required
  • Valid Guard Card; required 
  • CA State Firearm permit (Exposed firearm permit); required
  • Security guard experience; preferred
  • Prior military experience and/or current or past experience as an Security guard; preferred
  • Exhibit excellent customer service and hospitality skills - the Security Guard greets everyone who enters the lobby, and will be responsible for welcoming our guests and visitors with the kindness and friendliness befitting of In-N-Out Burger
  • Possess strong communication skills
  • Must be reliable and able to work without constant direct supervision 
  • High school diploma or GED; required 

Physical Requirements:
  • Ability to patrol the property and access areas quickly
  • Physically able to capture and detain individuals if necessary
  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and monitoring surveillance equipment
  • Must be able to lift 50 pounds at a time


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Senior Software QA Engineer
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

Join a high-impact engineering team transforming legacy and modern systems into scalable, world-class products. As a Senior QA Engineer, you’ll define advanced testing strategies, lead automation across platforms, and ensure thousands of users experience reliable, intuitive software every day. You’ll be a key voice in a collaborative, product-focused culture—solving complex problems, elevating quality practices, and mentoring others as we grow our next generation of applications. Help drive the quality transformation behind an iconic brand and shape the technology our business depends on.

The Senior QA Engineer is responsible for leading QA efforts across multiple applications and teams. This role defines advanced test strategies, scales automation frameworks, drives process improvements, and ensures enterprise standards for quality. They mentor junior QA associates and serve as a key technical leader in cross-functional initiatives.
 
*This position is full-time, in-office only.
 
Essential Functions

• Ability to report to work at the prescribed time for each scheduled shift and to fulfil the job requirements for the duration of the shift or until relieved of all duties by a direct supervisor.
• Reliable and predictable attendance.
• Ability to understand and follow directions from a supervisor.
• Ability to understand and follow posted work rules and procedures.
• Ability to interact cordially and productively with co-workers to accomplish common tasks.
• Ability to receive constructive criticism in a professional manner.
• Ability to cope with stressful circumstances.
• Perform all work-related tasks as needed or assigned by a direct supervisor.
• Compliance with corporate privacy policies and practices to ensure that all company information and data is kept confidential unless specifically authorized for release.
• For positions that require operating a company vehicle, maintain a valid driver’s license and a good driving record.

General Responsibilities

• Define and implement advanced test strategies, frameworks, and methodologies
• Lead development and scaling of automation frameworks. Integrate with CI/CD pipelines
• Conduct advanced performance, security, and accessibility testing
• Mentor and coach junior and mid-level QA team members. Provide technical guidance
• Collaborate with engineering, UX, and product stakeholders to ensure high-quality delivery
• Lead defect management processes and ensure enterprise-level tracking/reporting
• Drive continuous QA process improvements and innovation


Work Schedule + Benefits

Full-time, Exempt
Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00am - 5:00 pm
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Salary range: $107,367 - $140,000 annually
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

• High School diploma or equivalent; Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field preferred.
• Agile/Scrum Product Owner or ScrumMaster Certification preferred.
• 5+ years of progressive QA Experience, including leadership of test automation and strategy preferred.
• Strong problem-solving skills
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Excellent communication abilities

Tools & Technology Requirements

• Computer (PC).
• Laptop and iPad.
• Standard office equipment.
• Playwright
• Jenkins
• Jira Software and Confluence
• JMeter
• Microsoft office with Visio

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Boneless Beef Inventory Controller
description_html:
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Boneless Beef Inventory Clerk in our Lathrop, Ca. Meat Department. This position reports to the Deboning Room Supervisor and is responsible for tracking all the meat that is deboned by our butchers and assist with vendor PO’s associated with meat production. Experience within ground our beef production, preferably within patty production, is required.

General Responsibilities: 

  • Check meat to verify no contamination 
  • Aspen system (complete labels to go onto vats) vendors, date, PO, USDA info 
  • Stacking, arranging, pulling meat 
  • Assist trimmers by trimming anything they may have missed 
  • Disassembly of detection equipment ass needed 
  • Ensure that boneless beef flows smoothly for microbial sampling  
  • Performs other job-related duties as required.

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Pay Range: $25.00 to $27.50/hourly DOE
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Hours: 6:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.; some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • A minimum of three (3) years’ experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar 
  • Ground beef production and patty packing production experience required 
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room 
  • Pallet Jack experience preferred 

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs. 
  • Cold working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit; Temperature fluctuations in the warehouse  
  • Repetitive Action - Packing meat patties, stacking, feeding, labeling, rotating, inspecting, cleaning tools and equipment, keeping meat department organized and clean
  • Physical demands - Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger


In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Colorado and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Warehouse Worker
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Warehouse Associate in our Draper, Utah warehouse. The Warehouse Worker will be responsible for pulling food orders from storage areas to prepare for sending out to the restaurants.

General Responsibilities

• Order pulling on a routine basis: Moving food items from storage areas to the shipping pallet

• Physically pull orders from shelves and load them onto forklifts

• Transport packed items onto the shipping pallet; assist in loading onto the delivery truck

• Receiving and entering all paperwork into the computer, such as invoices, production sheets and inter-store

• Reviewing daily delivery reports and report any discrepancies

• Making special deliveries to the In-N-Out stores using a company vehicle, van or refrigerated Bobtail truck

Work Schedule + Benefits

• Full-time, Hourly, Benefit

• Thursday - Sunday 10:00am to 8:30pm (Will become a rotating shift)

• Overtime as needed; Weekend and holiday availability required

• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan

• Free meals on work days

Job Requirements:

• High school diploma or GED (required)

• A minimum of one (1) year experience as an Order Puller

• Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis

• Demonstrated ability to perform at a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness

• Computer proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook; proficiency in PowerPoint a plus

• Exceptional oral and written communication skills

• Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations

• Represent the company in a positive and professional manner

• Valid non-commercial Utah driver’s license (required)

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Colorado, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Restaurant Food Safety and Quality Assurance Field Specialist - Santa Clarita Valley
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Restaurant Food Safety and Quality Assurance Field Specialist in the Santa Clarita Valley. This position will be covering the areas of North LA County, Santa Clarita, and the counties of Kern, San Luis Obispo, Ventura, Santa Barbara etc. It is preferred if the individual lives near the area they will oversee (They will be based in Baldwin Park Office).

This position is responsible for providing support to our restaurants, both directly and through assisting in the development and maintenance of materials, systems, and programs to promote food safety and quality in restaurants and ensure regulatory compliance.

General Responsibilities:

• Remain knowledgeable of, and communicate regarding, jurisdiction specific requirements
• Assist stores in resolving regulatory challenges by acting as a liaison between local health departments and In-N-Out
• Maintain strong working relationships with key regulators (e.g. local or state health department regulators)
• Report on key metrics
• Foster mutually beneficial business relationships through needs identification and the delivery of business requirements
• Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and resolve any critical issues impacting the business
• Analyze relevant data to identify potential food safety concerns and follow-up appropriately
• Completion of assigned projects to meet department goals and objectives
• Provide input for improvement to the Restaurant Food Safety plan
• Execute Restaurant Food Safety plan  
• Perform store visits and audit for compliance with Restaurant Food Safety Plan and train in areas of deficiency
• Train Shift Managers and Divisional Managers in the area of Food Safety, and provide hands-on training as needed

Work Schedule + Benefits:

• Full-time, Exempt; Salary range: $83,764 - $103,000 annually
• The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition.  Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
• Rotating schedule, primarily Monday through Friday variable hours based on business needs and at least one weekend per 4-week period required
• Occasional after-hours, holidays, and additional weekend hours may be required 
• Regional and Overnight Travel is required, typically up to 50% of the time. 
• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Flex Spending Accounts, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance.

Qualifications:

• Minimum of bachelor’s degree, preferably in biology, chemistry, public health, or another closely related science (required)
• Minimum 5 years’ experience in the food service industry with responsibility in food safety, training, and development of written materials (required) 
• Strong knowledge and understanding of retail food safety principles and regulations (required) 
• Intermediate to advanced computer skills (Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook) 
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to interact professionally with all levels of management 
• Ability to plan, organize, and execute training
• Ability to collaborate and work as part of a team
• Ability to work independently and with a focus on continuous improvement
• Ability to write business reports and present to groups
• CP-FS or RS/REHS professional credential eligible
• Valid CA driver's license is required 

For Store associates:

  • Minimum one (1) year tenure with In-N-Out Burger
  • Minimum Level 5
  • No Final Warnings in the last six (6) months and must be in good standing with Management

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

This position is responsible for providing support to our restaurants, both directly and through assisting in the development and maintenance of materials, systems, and programs to promote food safety and quality in restaurants and ensure regulatory compliance.
General Responsibilities:
•
Remain knowledgeable of, and communicate regarding, jurisdiction specific requirements
•
Assist stores in resolving regulatory challenges by acting as a liaison between local health departments and In-N-Out
•
Maintain strong working relationships with key regulators (e.g. local or state health department regulators)
•
Report on key metrics
•
Foster mutually beneficial business relationships through needs identification and the delivery of business requirements
•
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify and resolve any critical issues impacting the business
•
Analyze relevant data to identify potential food safety concerns and follow-up appropriately
•
Completion of assigned projects to meet department goals and objectives
•
Provide input for improvement to the Restaurant Food Safety plan
•
Execute Restaurant Food Safety plan
•
Perform store visits and audit for compliance with Restaurant Food Safety Plan and train in areas of deficiency
•
Train Shift Managers and Divisional Managers in the area of Food Safety, and provide hands-on training as needed
Work Schedule + Benefits:
•
Full-time, Exempt; Salary range: $83,764 - $103,000 annually
•
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition.  Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
•
Rotating schedule, primarily Monday through Friday variable hours based on business needs and at least one weekend per 4-week period required
•
Occasional after-hours, holidays, and additional weekend hours may be required
•
Regional and Overnight Travel is required, typically up to 50% of the time.
•
Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Flex Spending Accounts, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance.
Qualifications:
•
Minimum of bachelor’s degree, preferably in biology, chemistry, public health, or another closely related science (required)
•
Minimum 5 years’ experience in the food service industry with responsibility in food safety, training, and development of written materials (required)
•
Strong knowledge and understanding of retail food safety principles and regulations (required)
•
Intermediate to advanced computer skills (Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)
•
Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to interact professionally with all levels of management
•
Ability to plan, organize, and execute training
•
Ability to collaborate and work as part of a team
•
Ability to work independently and with a focus on continuous improvement
•
Ability to write business reports and present to groups
•
CP-FS or RS/REHS professional credential eligible
•
Valid CA driver's license is required
For Store associates:
Minimum one (1) year tenure with In-N-Out Burger
Minimum Level 5
No Final Warnings in the last six (6) months and must be in good standing with Management
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Marketing Graphic Designer I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

In-N-Out Burger has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Marketing Graphic Designer I based in our Irvine, CA* location. This position is primarily responsible supporting the creative team by executing design solutions for day-to-day projects using established brand guidelines while developing foundational skills in In-N-Out Burger's brand identity and design standards.

The Marketing team at In-N-Out Burger works on a wide variety of projects with an emphasis on offering creative and personal development opportunities; encouraging each team member to continually grow their knowledge and skill set.  The team strives to foster a culture of collaboration in order to achieve larger goals in a supportive environment.   
 
*This position is full-time, in-office only.
 
General Responsibilities

  • Execute design solutions for smaller-scale projects including social media posts, digital ads, web banners, emails, flyers, event materials, and in-store campaigns using pre-approved visual directions to support marketing initiatives and brand consistency.
  • Adapt and version existing creative assets by applying established look and feel to various formats and platforms to maintain cohesive brand messaging across all materials.
  • Edit and retouch photos and preexisting creative materials to meet project specifications and ensure quality standards are maintained.
  • Prepare production files and create editable templates from approved creative to streamline workflows and improve team efficiency.
  • Collaborate with project managers and social/digital coordinators to fulfill design requests that support marketing efforts for food promotions, events, foundations, and merchandise.
  • Participate in brainstorming sessions with team members to contribute fresh perspectives and support creative problem-solving.
  • Support team continuity by assisting with project coverage when team members are unavailable to ensure timely delivery of materials.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00am - 5:00 pm
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime and availability outside of regular hours
  • Role will require occasional travel 10-20% of the time
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance 
  • Pay Range is $27.90-$30.85 per hour 
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field preferred.
  • Relevant certifications in graphic design software or tools (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite) are desirable.
  • Up to 2 years of experience in graphic design, with a portfolio demonstrating foundational design skills.
  • Experience with social media graphics, digital design, and print materials is preferred.
  • Strong Customer Service skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong time-management and organizational skills
  • Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively as part of a team
  • Creativity and adaptability to change
  • Proactive & Positive Mindset
  • Digital literacy and tech-adaptability
  • Standard office equipment
  • Proficiency with Adobe Creative Suite (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
  • Familiarity with project management tools (e.g., Asana, Teams) desirable.
  • Basic understanding of motion graphics tools (e.g., Adobe After Effects) is a plus.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint).

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Spread Room Operator
description_html:
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Machine Operator in our Lancaster, Texas distribution Center. 

General Responsibilities:

  • Manual stacking of cases
  • Operating packaging equipment to build pallets
  • Cleaning and sanitation work
  • Constructing edible product
  • Other activities as directed by the supervisor

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Starting Pay: $24.00- 26.00/HR DOE
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Must be able to work the following shifts which will rotate on a monthly basis: 
    • 1st   Shift: 5 am – 1:30 pm  (Monday – Thursday)
    • 2nd Shift: 1 pm – 9:30 pm (Monday – Thursday)
  • Department needs may call for weekend and holiday scheduling
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience (preferred)
  • Forklift certification (preferred)
  • Must be a self-starter and demonstrate a high degree of accuracy and thoroughness
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management


Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 35 degrees Fahrenheit and stand for up to eight (10) hours on a continuous basis
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 75 lbs.

title: HR Business Partner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a Full-time Human Resources Business Partner based in our Irvine, CA office*. The HR Business Partner will report to a Regional HR Manager of the HR Department. The HR Business Partner serves as a strategic partner and to our Stores and/or Business Unit Associates, Management, and the HR function to deliver value-added HR services, which include resolving Associate relations issues and providing HR policy guidance and interpretation.

*This position is full-time, in-office only.

General Responsibilities

  • Serve as a trusted advisor to leaders on a broad array of HR issues, including coaching, counseling, performance management, workplace accommodations, conflict resolution, engagement, compensation and building positive work environments.
  • Conduct internal investigations on workplace situations that may be highly sensitive, confidential, or complex and prepare all required documentation with a focus on issue resolution.
  • Partner with managers on the development of corrective action and implementation of performance improvement plans.
  • Responsible for the interpretation of HR policies and procedures, while ensuring compliance with company policies and procedures.
  • Provide analysis and recommend appropriate action and education to managers and/or associates on specific HR issues.
  • Apply knowledge of progressive HR practices and key trends to address business issues related to areas such as training, engagement, staffing, and retention.
  • Contribute to the development and facilitation of training seminars for leaders on various HR topics.
  • Provide leadership development and training to all levels of Management to enable them to coach their team members effectively.
  • Collaborate with HR peers to evaluate and to develop innovative programs and services.
  • Utilize company HCM systems to provide management with valid and actionable HR data, KPI’s, and dashboards.
  • Consult with Compensation on the Company philosophy around the merit and promotion processes, as well as supporting the Performance Appraisal process.
  • Engage in other associate relations duties and complete HR projects as needed.

Skills Needed

  • Associate Support & Conflict Resolution: Act as the go-to person for Associate concerns, complaints, and workplace conflicts. Helps resolve issues fairly and with care.
  • Policy Guidance & Compliance: Advises managers and Associates on HR policies, performance management, and labor law fundamentals. Help to make sure decisions align with company standards and legal requirements
  • Case Management: Investigates Associate relations cases, documents findings, and helps resolve issues like misconduct, harassment, or policy violations.
  • Coaching: Partners with managers to guide Associate and leadership conversations, helping associates understand areas for growth and development. Delivers workshops on HR topics to Shift Managers.
  • Communication & Documentation: Handles a high volume of HR inquiries and drafts clear, professional documentation to support decisions and case outcomes

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Exempt
  • May choose between a standard Monday–Friday schedule or a 9/80 compressed workweek, with core hours from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. The 9/80 schedule provides either every other Monday or every other Friday off. Occasional Saturday shifts (8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.) are required, approximately five times per year.
  • Some scheduling flexibility and travel is required for off-site meetings and/or field visits.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range: $95,200-$117,000 
  • *The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred. Equivalent experience may substitute for the degree requirement.
  • Must have 2–6+ years of Human Resources and Associate Relations experience working with large hourly workforces and applying various states labor laws.
  • Strong preference for experience gained in muti-site foodservice or retail environments.
  • Strong customer service skills, including the ability to build trusting partnerships across the business.
  • Demonstrated ability to invoke change by influencing rather than directing management.
  • Ability to strategically analyze data and examine issues while identifying themes and creating solutions.
  • Associate relations, employment law, compensation, performance management, and recruitment skills.
  • Professional and confidential in all interactions with proven coaching and conflict resolution skills.
  • Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills required.
  • Outstanding organizational skills: including the ability to effectively prioritize and meet deadlines, as well as multi-task in a fast-paced environment.
  • This position requires approximately 10% travel to both local and out of state locations.
  • Bilingual (English-Spanish) is a plus.
  • HR Certification (SHRM/PHR) a plus

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its West Coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.


In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Patty Room Packer
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for full-time Patty Room Technicians based in our Lathrop, CA warehouse.    

The Patty Room technician will work in the Meat processing department and must be able to work prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit. 

General Responsibilities

  • Stacking and packing the meat patties at the end of the patty line
  • Prepping meat patty crates, packing patties into crates, label and stack crates at the end of the line
  • Final inspection of all products before it is packed to ship
  • Assist in disassembling all equipment after production has ended each day
  • Assisting in other meat department positions when necessary 

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
    • Pay Range: $23.75 to $24.75/hourly DOE

    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors

  • Hours: 6:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.; some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or GED
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience 
  • Experience with food line work; repetitive line work
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room 

Physical Demands/Requirements

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs. 
  • Cold working conditions - Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit; Temperature fluctuations in the warehouse  
  • Repetitive Action - Packing meat patties, stacking, feeding, labeling, rotating, inspecting, cleaning tools and equipment, keeping meat department organized and clean
  • Physical demands - Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger


In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Colorado and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Senior HR Business Partner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
   
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in our Lathrop office! 

The Senior Human Resources Business Partner (Sr. HRBP) reports to the Regional HR Manager and plays a pivotal role in providing strategic HR support to our Stores and highly complex Corporate Departments. This position serves as a trusted advisor in supporting organizational goals and objectives, workforce planning and performance management. The Senior HRBP also leads and supports key HR projects and initiatives, demonstrating advanced expertise in HR disciplines and competencies.

General Responsibilities
  • Serve as a trusted advisor to assigned Stores, highly complex Support Departments, and business leaders, addressing medium- to complex employee relations issues.
  • Make strategic management recommendations impacting team performance and coach managers to keep employees accountable for meeting goals.
  • Conduct regular meetings with team leaders to understand talent requirements and business goals. Drive talent review and assessments by facilitating succession and performance calibration sessions.
  • Coach business leaders on the appropriate tools and resources for team development, championing mentorship programs, leadership development, and training.
  • Prepare internal equity analysis and provide recommendations for Support leaders addressing outcomes related to job offers, promotions, transfers, terminations, and strategic management decisions impacting team performance.
  • Work in partnership with other HR functions to contribute to key HR projects, including process workflows, change management, and workforce planning.
  • Drive the strategy and lead larger projects contributing to multiple areas of the organization, such as the annual performance review process.
  • Develop insights from people data (engagement surveys, exit interviews, etc.) to inform talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies.
  • Provide ongoing development, training, and mentorship for HR team members.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Office Hours in Lathrop, CA : Monday-Friday, 8AM - 5 PM or a 9/80 compressed workweek with core hours from 8AM-6PM, with every other Monday or Friday off.
  • Occasional Saturday shifts (8 AM- 5 PM) required (approximately 5 per year).
  • Some scheduling flexibility is required for off-site meetings and travel to satellite offices.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range: $115,000-$140,000 annually + bonus potential
  • The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • BA/BS degree in a relevant field or equivalent years of HR experience; a Master’s degree in human resources or a related field is a plus.
  • 8+ years of Human Resources experience, with a background in providing HR support to both corporate and field-based teams. 
  • 5+ years of proven experience as a strategic HRBP with experience in talent development, succession planning, compensation, performance management, and workforce planning.
  • Demonstrated ability to coach business leaders using effective communication, active listening, and motivational techniques for team development.
  • Striving for excellence and aspirational in talent management initiatives.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively with other HR functions and departments, demonstrating strong interpersonal skills and adaptability in various project environments.
  • Demonstrated project management skills, including planning, execution, and monitoring, with the ability to drive the strategy and lead projects contributing to organizational goals.
  • Ability to influence project outcomes and gain support from key stakeholders.
  • Demonstrates a bias for action and a driven approach to achieving strategic goals.
  • Experience in providing ongoing development, training, and mentorship to HR team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth within the team.

About In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

Experience in providing ongoing development, training, and mentorship to HR team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth within the team.

We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

title: Administrative Assistant III - Accounting
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

The In-N-Out Burger Accounting team has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Administrative Assistant III based in the Irvine, CA* office. This position will report to the Director of Accounting & Controller and will be responsible for supporting the administrative needs of the department, including direct support of the department Director.

*This position is full-time, in-office only*

General Responsibilities

* Handle administrative tasks and projects for the Director of Accounting, including scheduling meetings, answering phones, handling requests, and managing correspondence.

* Perform invoice reviews and create budget reviews.

* Prepare PowerPoint presentations and department newsletters using software tools such as Adobe, or Word.

* Coordinate department special events such as lunches, parties, and team outings.

* Organize meetings and events through event planning skills, handling logistics and follow-up activities.

* Manage expenses and receipts using Concur.

* Coordinate “front desk” activities, ensuring a welcoming environment for visitors and Associates.

* Assist with other Ad-hoc responsibilities.

* Strive to develop strong working relationships with many Associates throughout the company.

Work Schedule + Benefits

* Full-time position, Non-Exempt

* Pay Range is $33.29 - $38.29 per hour. This represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

* Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm

* Department needs may call for occasional overtime

* Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications

* 4+ years of experience in an administrative role, required

* Exceptional organizational and time-management skills with the ability to prioritize deliverables

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to interact professionally with all levels of management

* Meticulous attention to detail and ability to perform tasks with accuracy and efficiency

* Highly adaptable with excellent follow-through skills

* Proven ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously while remaining organized and efficient

* Highly motivated self-starter

* Desire to learn continually and willingness to try new approaches to administration

* Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office software, including Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word, required. Experience with Asana, Adobe, and Microsoft Teams, preferred.

* Previous experience preparing budget reviews, variance analyses, performing invoice reviews, and creating Concur expense reports, highly preferred.

*4-year degree, preferred

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

title: Heavy Duty Diesel Technician
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Heavy Duty Diesel Mechanic (Experienced level) currently based in our Chino, CA facility. The Heavy Duty Diesel Mechanic is responsible for performing preventative maintenance and repairs on all In-N-Out Burger equipment, ensuring optimal functionality, safety, and reliability across the fleet.

General Responsibilities

  • Perform routine preventative maintenance on company vehicles, heavy-duty equipment, including tractors, trailers, lift gates, reefer units, and generators, ensuring strict adherence to manufacturer guidelines and Department of Transportation (DOT) regulations.
  • Execute preventive maintenance tasks such as oil changes, tire checks, fluid checks, filter replacements, and other essential preventive measures to maintain the fleet’s optimal performance and minimize downtime.
  • Demonstrate proficiency in diagnosing, repairing, and replacing minor components such as lights, mudflaps, mirrors, air lines, batteries, belts, and various cab components.
  • Effectively diagnose and repair medium and major components, including powertrain systems, suspension systems, wheel-end components, and engine systems, ensuring efficient vehicle performance.
  • Troubleshoot and repair complex systems such as aftertreatment, HVAC, hydraulic systems, and reefer units, ensuring that all systems operate reliably and efficiently.
  • Conduct thorough post-repair safety checks to ensure that all repaired vehicles meet the required safety standards and regulatory requirements.
  • Accurately maintain records of vehicle maintenance, repairs, parts usage, and services performed in electronic databases or maintenance software, ensuring compliance with company policies and industry standards.
  • Keep up with the latest technological advancements and industry trends, actively sharing knowledge with associates to enhance skills and improve operational efficiency.
  • Collaborate with supervisors and associates to ensure the timely availability of parts and tools, ensuring uninterrupted maintenance and repair operations.
  • Work effectively with other associates to troubleshoot and resolve complex mechanical or electrical issues, providing expertise and working collaboratively to achieve optimal results.
  • Guide and mentor less experienced associates, providing leadership and support for their professional development and technical proficiency.
  • Respond to roadside calls and replace tires, providing tire repair services and minor repairs in a safe, timely, and efficient manner to minimize operational downtime.
  • Procure necessary parts and tools for repairs through established processes, ensuring purchases are in compliance with IN-N-Out procedures and accounting practices.
  • Maintain precise records of parts usage, ensuring inventory levels are monitored and managed accurately to avoid delays or shortages that could affect repair timelines.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time- Hourly
  • The hours for this position: Sun-Thursday 7:00am-3:30pm
  • Overtime and holiday availability required.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on work days 
  • Pay Range is $32.25 - $36.50 per hour

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

  • 50-pound lifting requirement.
  • Valid Class C driver's license is required. 
  • Valid Class A is Highly preferred
  • 609 and 608 certified is highly preferred
  • Minimum 3 years of heavy automotive diesel mechanic experience is required
  • Experience with replacing A/C parts (i.e. compressor, filter/dryer, expansion valve, etc.)
  • Basic understanding of hydraulic systems and truck after-treatment systems is required 
  • Able to perform minor lift gate repairs
  • Completion of an accredited vocational diesel automotive school certificate is preferred 
  • Excellent communication skills and proven track record of dependability, attention to detail, and a strong commitment to achieve company cleanliness standards.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Washington, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Sanitation Assistant Supervisor
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Sanitation Assistant Supervisor based in our Chino, CA Meat Department. The Sanitation Assistant Supervisor will be accountable to the Sanitation Supervisor and will oversee the sanitation operations at our Chino meat and spread production facility. This role involves ensuring that our standard sanitation operating procedures (SSOPs) adhere to industry best practices and comply with regulations set forth by OSHA, USDA, and other regulatory bodies.

 Job Duties: 

  • Assist in the growth and development of the sanitation associates and leads. 
  • Create one-point lessons, standard operating procedures, and maintain training programs for sanitation associates. 
  • Provide timely feedback and ensure all Associates are complying with safety standards and sanitation expectations.
  • Coordinate the master sanitation schedule. 
  • Prepare and set-up equipment, chemicals, and other necessary items for the start of the shift.  
  • Conduct chemical checks throughout the shift.  
  • Inspect and complete all paperwork (Tool Checklist, Pre-Op Sheet, Chemical check sheet, Attendance sheet, etc.)  
  • Pre-Operational Inspection: Ensure all machines, equipment, and utensils are properly cleaned to meet In-N-Out Burger and USDA Standards.   
  • Serve as a back-up to the Supervisor and support when needed. 
  • Ensure that the team runs fully staffed and support when needed. 

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Compensation Range: $32.26 - $37.00/hour DOE
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Approx. Hours: 4:00 p.m. to 1:00 a.m.; some overtime as needed (start times may vary)
  • 5 days per week 
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications:

  • A minimum of 5 years' experience leading Sanitation teams. (Required)
  • Experience leading large teams. (Preferred)
  • Bilingual (Spanish/ English preferred).
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to anticipate problems and solve them before they occur. 
  • Strong attention to detail.  
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. 
  • Experience in creating and implementing training programs. 
  • Experience coordinating and monitoring cleaning schedules.
  • Experience implementing corrective actions to ensure compliance.
  • HACCP certified a plus

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb ladders and not be afraid of heights 
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings 
  • Will work in cold, damp environments; will work in warm, damp environments 
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees 
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit 
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Sanitation Technician I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Sanitation Technician in our Meat Department located in Chino, CA. The Sanitation Technician will be required to work afternoon and evening shifts within the Meat processing department, receiving an hourly wage ranging from $24.25-$26.25, depending on experience, in addition to benefits.


General Responsibilities:

  • Be directly responsible for cleaning and sanitizing the commissary plant equipment
  • Clean large food processing equipment; Chemicals will be used during the sanitation process
  • Responsible for operation of sanitation equipment such as the pressure washer
  • Wash and sanitize all commissary plant property using proper cleaning procedures
  • Clean meat crates and blue plastic pallets/crates
  • Clean and sanitize food processing equipment, roof, fans, ceilings, walls and floors using specific procedures as directed
  • Use all proper cleaning procedures so that it meets with both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards
  • Assist in reassembling equipment when necessary
  • Monitor and document chemical concentrations to ensure proper cleaning of equipment
  • Follow all safety policies and procedures at all times

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $24.25-$26.25 per hour DOE           
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Hours: 4:00 p.m. to 12:30 a.m.; some overtime as needed (start times may vary)
  • 5 nights per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities
  • One (1) year Sanitation or Janitorial  experience, preferably in a food processing plant
  • Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for  all chemicals used in cleaning activities

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb tall ladders and not be afraid of heights
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
  • Will work in an environment that is wet, damp, and humid; will undergo temperature changes from hot to cold
  • Will wear rain gear while hosing down equipment
  • Exposure to chemical cleaning solution (with protective gear)
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Sanitation Technician I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Sanitation Technician in our Lancaster, TX Meat Processing Facility.  The Sanitation Technician will  earn an hourly wage of  $23.28 - $25.20/HR plus benefits depending on experience.

General Responsibilities:

  • Be directly responsible for maintaining the sanitation of the commissary plant equipment
  • Use all proper cleaning procedures so that it meets with both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards
  • Clean and sanitize food processing equipment
  • Assist in reassembling equipment when necessary
  • Monitor and document chemical concentrations to ensure proper cleaning of equipment
  • Follow all safety policies and procedures at all times

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $23.28 to $25.20/hourly DOE
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Shift Hours: 2:00 p.m. to 10:30 p.m (Monday thru Thursday) 
  • Shift Hours: 12 p.m. to 8:30 p.m (Friday- Sunday)
  • 2 Days off per week/ Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Job Requirements:

  •  High school diploma or GED
  • One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities preferred but not required
  • Sanitation experience in a food processing plant  preferred but not required
  • Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for  all chemicals used in cleaning activities

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb ladders and not be afraid of heights
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
  • Will work in cold, damp environments; will work in warm, damp environments
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees
  • Will wear rain gear while hosing down equipment
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington, and Tennessee. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Accounting Manager
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated Accounting Manager based in our Irvine, CA* office. 

The Accounting Manager is an integral part of the accounting leadership team, responsible for overseeing AP/PO matching, supplier master maintenance, and PPD and accrued account reconciliations. This person will lead a team of 6-7, provide developmental support, and partner cross-functionally to enhance system use and operational efficiency. This position reports to the Assistant Controller.

This role will focus specifically on Accounts Payable and Procurement operations, with a strong emphasis on process optimization, workflow automation, and team leadership but AP & Procurement experience is not required to be considered.

*This position is 100% in-office and based in Irvine, CA.

General Responsibilities:

 * Oversee all Accounts Payable and Procurement operations, including PO matching, invoice processing, and supplier master file maintenance
 * Provide hands-on leadership and coaching to a team of 6-7, with varying experience levels
 * Manage team performance, development, and engagement—especially important as many team members are internal promotions or early in their careers
 * Own reconciliations for PPD and accrued accounts
 * Lead system and workflow enhancements to improve invoice processing, AP/PO automation, and ERP utilization
 * Partner cross-functionally with departments such as Maintenance, IT, and Real Estate to ensure optimal AP/Procurement functionality
 * Play an active role in ERP-related projects, including workflow rollout and future Supply Chain ERP implementation
 * Balance compliance with a collaborative, service-minded approach
 * Support month-end close and contribute to reporting as needed
 * Build strong relationships with internal stakeholders and demonstrate a culture of care, transparency, and accountability

Work Schedule + Benefits:

 * Full-time, Salaried, Exempt
 * Salary Range: $125,000 - $175,000 annually. This represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
 * Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM-5:00 PM
 * Excellent Benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance

Requirements:

 * Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related field
 * Active CPA license required
 * Minimum of 7 years of progressive accounting experience, including a mix of public and private sector work
 * 2-5 years of supervisory or management experience
 * Experience leading AP and/or Procurement teams (preferred)
 * Demonstrated ability to build team morale, develop talent, and lead with humility
 * Excellent communication skills, clear, concise, and professional
 * Proactive, solutions-oriented, and able to manage ambiguity or shifting priorities
 * Strong technical skills, including:
 * Oracle ERP 
 * Excel (advanced proficiency required)
 * Procurement workflow tools (preferred)

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

Work Location Details

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

title: Accounts Payable Analyst II
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Accounts Payable Analyst II based in our Irvine, CA location*. Reporting to the Accounts Payable Supervisor, be an integral part of a team dedicated to financial accuracy and excellence. In this role, you will play a critical part in the accuracy and efficiency of our accounts payable processes. You will be responsible for reviewing and processing invoices and expense reports, verifying purchase orders, preparing payments, and maintaining strong vendor relationships. The ideal candidate will have 2-5+ years of accounts payable experience and a solid understanding of general accounting practices.

*This position is full-time, in-office only. 

Key Responsibilities 
  • Review and process invoices and employee expense reports, ensuring that all details are accurate and compliant with company policies and procedures. Verify that purchases align with purchase orders and contracts.
  • Work closely with internal departments and vendors to resolve discrepancies and exceptions related to invoices, including pricing issues, missing documentation, or discrepancies between purchase orders and invoices.
  • Prepare and process payments to vendors in a timely manner. Ensure payment terms are adhered to and assist in the preparation of payment runs, including check, ACH, and wire transfers.
  • Vendor Relationship Management: Serve as the point of contact for vendor inquiries, ensuring timely resolution of payment-related concerns. Foster and maintain positive relationships with vendors, addressing issues with professionalism and care.
  • Reconcile accounts payable records to ensure that all transactions are accurate. Assist in the monthly and year-end closing processes by preparing accounts payable reports, ensuring all invoices are recorded, and past due invoices are addressed.
  • Work with purchasing, receiving, and other departments to verify purchase orders, resolve discrepancies, and maintain smooth accounts payable operations.
  • Perform regular audits of accounts payable transactions to ensure compliance with company policies, internal controls, and applicable regulations. Assist with internal and external audits as needed.
  • Suggest and implement process improvements to streamline accounts payable functions, enhance efficiency, and reduce errors. Actively participate in efforts to optimize the accounts payable workflow.

Work Schedule & Benefits 
  • Full-time position, Non-Exempt  
  • Onsite, in office hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm 
  • Occasional travel required to corporate offices and satellite locations in CA and TN, depending on business needs. 
  • Pay Range is $30.25-$33.45/hr.*Represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance 
 
Qualifications  
  • High school diploma or equivalent required
  • 2-5+ years of experience in accounts payable or related fields
  • Working knowledge of general accounting practices
  • Previous experience with Oracle Fusion and Concur preferred
  • Accounts Payable Specialist (APS) Certification is highly preferred. If the candidate does not currently hold the APS certification, they will be required to obtain it within one (1) year of employment as a condition of continued employment.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams required
  • Exposure to ERP software, Teams, and Zoom is preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment 
 
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger 
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.
 
In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.
