title: Concierge Events Planner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full time Concierge Events Planner on the Concierge events team in Baldwin Park, CA.  This role currently operates out of Baldwin Park, CA, but will be relocating to the Franklin, TN office in summer 2026. 

This position is responsible for the research, planning, and execution of Personal, Corporate, and Philanthropic travel for In-N-Out Burger's Owner and Family.

General Responsibilities
• Provide concierge, white glove level service in planning and on-site/off-site execution
• Research and coordinate travel arrangements ensuring that reservations for air travel, car rentals, and overnight accommodations are accurate and that itineraries and instructions are communicated in a timely manner.
• Analyze services provided by various vendors and provide recommendation as appropriate.
• With guidance from the Concierge Manager, problem solve and make decisions utilizing policies, procedures, and business plans
• Work with the Concierge events team to plan 50+ events per year
• Collaborate and partner with the Events Teams as well as cross-functional teams in striving for successful high-quality events
• Collaborate with team members in providing the highest-level of service and support
• Providing on-site event support (weekday & weekend) is required
• Research destinations, locations, and points of interest including resorts, hotels, campsites, and other accommodations as well as activities and transportation
• Develop and create trip presentations from research, collaborating with Concierge Manager throughout
• On-site or off-site support and concierge level service extended to family members/VIPs
• Create itinerary, travel documents, and operations plans
• Handle & manage multiple expense reports
• Administrative tracking including logistics, flight & travel logs, digital itineraries, budgeting, forecasting, and reconciliation.

Work Schedule + Benefits
• Full-time position, Exempt
• Pay Range is $89,000-$100,000
The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
• Office location: Position currently in Baldwin Park, CA, but will move to Franklin, TN summer 2026 
• Nights, Weekends, and Holiday availability required
• Travel: 30%-40% travel, including overnight hotel stays, both domestic and international travel
• On-call availability for travel changes and modifications 
• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
• 5+ years experience as an Event Planner, Executive Personal Assistant, or Concierge Travel Planner required
• Polished verbal and written communication, problem solving, and detail oriented thinking/skills
• Positive attitude, excellent follow-through, and strong communication skills
• Exceptional customer service traits in handling VIP/Executive Family members requiring high touch reservation assistance
• Ability to travel both domestically and internationally, 30-40% of the year 
• Software proficiency in: Microsoft Office Suite and O365 preferred
Physical Requirements:
• Must be able to stand and walk for long periods of time during events
• Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds at times
• Must be able to work a variety of hours in order to accommodate events


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: In-N-Out Burger Development Manager I (New Stores)
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

In-N-Out Burger is growing!  Help us develop and build more restaurants... 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time real estate Development Manager I based in our Baldwin Park, CA* office.  The Development Manager is responsible for the entitlement, design coordination, and permitting processes for new ground-up In-N-Out Burger restaurants in various markets.

*This position is full-time, in-office only – Baldwin Park, CA


General Responsibilities
  • The real estate Development Manager will be responsible for all steps in the restaurant development process, starting from the entitlement process, up to permitting and through construction
  • Extensive preparation and knowledge of entitlement submittals
  • Manage the entitlement process and work well with city planners, governmental agency and local jurisdictions requirements
  • Restaurant Operations experience is desirable but not mandatory
  • Project Management, Entitlement Processing, and/or Design experience in Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) with drive-through/Quick Casual Industry is desirable but not mandatory
  • Must be well versed in all phases of real estate project management; including building design, entitlement, permitting
  • The Development Manager I will manage the whole entitlement process, due diligence, permit research, and completion of applications
  • Manage engineers, architects, geotechnical, environmental, survey and various other consultants relative to due diligence, entitlements, and permit procurement
  • Experience serving an Applicant advocate role with city council or city planning commissioners
  • Submitting for and obtaining governmental entitlements like CUPs, DRC approvals,  and ultimately all required permits to commence construction  
  • Experience with Design and preparation of site plans and building elevations is desirable.
  • Work closely with other development teams including Real Estate Managers (site acquisition team), Legal, and Construction, as well as with 3rd party developers, landlords, architects engineers and municipalities  
  • Working on multiple projects concurrently, in varying geographic locations, all of which may be in various stages of the development process
  • Manage various aspects of real estate development from site selection to construction completion  
  • Perform project site analysis, site design and pro-forma budget projection for presentation 
  • Negotiate development agreements and assist with real estate purchase and lease negotiations
  • Manage project budgets and schedules
  • Coordinate with jurisdictions and various public agencies during design review process and entitlements to obtain desired building design, site design and meet operational standards

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Exempt 
  • Salary Range is $104,000-$140,000
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm 
  • Real Estate office is based in Baldwin Park, California
  • Requires significant field work and travel; will need to report to Baldwin Park, CA office
  • Travel time: 25% of the work time will be spent in the field and on pre-construction sites; will require occasional overnight travel to all seven states where INO operates
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications
  • Five (5) years+ experience with the entitlement process; Must have a working understanding of governmental entitlement process (required)
  • Strong experience in the state of California - entitlement and permitting, including  processing of EIR’s and Mitigated Negative Declarations
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture, Civil Engineering or Construction Management (preferred); or a combination of experience and education
  • Ten (10) years’ experience in design, or management of design teams, and familiarity with working drawings and construction practices, methods, and materials.
  • Extensive entitlement experience in NorCal/LA markets; strongly preferred     
  • QSR Drive-thru experience preferred
  • Experience being an Applicant representative at city hearings
  • Experience working with city Planning Staff and Leaders, Design Review Boards, Planning Commissions, City Councils 
  • Must have good knowledge of building codes, Title 24, ADA, basic utilities and green code 
  • Must have an understanding of construction, and the relationship between value engineering and construction costs, scheduling and physical elements building
  • Will possess a strong work ethic, excellent organization and communication skills, along with the ability to observe safety guidelines and work both autonomously and in a team-oriented atmosphere  


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Linen Specialist
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Linen Specialist in our Lathrop, CA warehouse.  The Linen Specialist will ensure that store uniforms are properly cleaned and delivered to local stores.

General Responsibilities

  • Receives and collects linen from the In-N-Out burger stores
  • Takes inventory of all dirty uniforms/ aprons that are received from the store
  • Inventories clean uniforms/aprons when they arrive from the linen company
  • Fulfills uniform request for each store using established procedures
  • Ensures work area is kept clean and hazard free

  • Full-time position, Hourly non-exempt
  • Pay Range is $22.50-$23.50 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Hours (Day shift): Morning start-time varies 
  • Must be able to work between the hours of 5:30 am – 5:00 pm, 5 days per week
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

title: Administrative Assistant II - Financial Planning & Business Analysis
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

The In-N-Out Burger Financial Planning and Business Analysis (FP&BA) team has an excellent opportunity for a full-time Administrative Assistant II based in the Irvine, CA* office. This position will report to the Financial Planning and Business Analysis Manager and will be responsible for supporting the administrative needs of the department, including direct support of the department Manager.

*This position is full-time, in-office only*

General Responsibilities

  • Handle administrative tasks and projects for the FP&BA department, including managing the team calendar, scheduling meetings, answering phones, handling requests, and managing correspondence.
  • Support project management efforts by creating, prioritizing, and updating workflows, preparing documentation, and tracking information to achieve team goals and deliverables.
  • Export financial transaction data from internal systems, format it into simple, user-friendly reports, and distribute to relevant stakeholders across the company.
  • Coordinate department special events such as lunches, parties, and team outings.
  • Manage department expenses and receipts using Concur.
  • Assist the team in organizing and prioritizing workloads to achieve team goals and meet deadlines.

Qualifications

  • 2-5 years’ experience in an administrative role, preferably in an Accounting or Finance department
  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Exceptional organizational experience and time-management skills with the ability to prioritize deliverables
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to interact professionally with all levels of management
  • General knowledge of, or interest in, finance and accounting is preferred; not required
  • Meticulous attention to detail and ability to perform tasks with accuracy and efficiency
  • Proven history of providing outstanding customer service while proactively troubleshooting/problem solving
  • Proven ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously while remaining organized and efficient
  • Highly motivated self-starter
  • Ability to work autonomously and independently, yet be an integral part of an overall team environment
  • Demonstrated ability to be flexible and highly adaptable to constant change based on business objectives
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft office software, including Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word. Asana, Slack, and Microsoft Teams a plus
  • Knowledge of Oracle Fusion ERP and EPM software preferred, but not required
  • Strong moral compass: ability to operate with integrity and professionalism when handling sensitive and confidential information
  • Highly adaptable with excellent time-management and follow-through skills

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Non-Exempt
  • Pay Range is $28.27 - $31.99 per hour
  • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Supply Chain Information Systems Analyst I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

As a Supply Chain Systems Analyst, you will play a vital role in optimizing warehouse operations by leveraging technology and deep understanding of warehouse operations. Your primary responsibility will be to support and maintain supply chain systems including ERP, WMS, manufacturing, quality, and other related technologies. This role requires a blend of technical expertise, analytical skills, and an understanding of business processes.

Please note that this is a full-time in-office position.

Essential Functions

  • Ability to report to work at the prescribed time for each scheduled shift and to fulfil the job requirements for the duration of the shift or until relieved of all duties by a direct supervisor.
  • Reliable and predictable attendance.
  • Ability to understand and follow directions from a supervisor.
  • Ability to understand and follow posted work rules and procedures.
  • Ability to interact cordially and productively with co-workers to accomplish common tasks.
  • Ability to receive constructive criticism in a professional manner.
  • Ability to cope with stressful circumstances.
  • Perform all work-related tasks as needed or assigned by a direct supervisor.
  • Compliance with corporate privacy policies and practices to ensure that all company information and data is kept confidential unless specifically authorized for release.
  • For positions that require operating a company vehicle, maintains a valid driver’s license and a safe driving record.

General Responsibilities

  • Provide support and training to warehouse staff on systems usage, best practices, and troubleshooting procedures.
  • Serve as primary point of contact for system-related inquiries and issues.
  • Recommend and implement enhancements to existing systems to streamline processes and improve operational efficiency.
  • Create documentation and user manuals for system processes and procedures
  • Conduct testing and quality assurance to ensure system functionality, reliability, and data integrity.
  • Participate in the implementation of supply chain systems and related technologies.

Required Qualifications

  • High School graduate or GED
  • 0-2 years of tech/applications support experience
  • CompTIA A+, Google IT Support Professional, or equivalent experience
  • Office 365, Slack, Jira experience or knowledge

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or equivalent experience
  • HighJump Certification or equivalent warehouse management system experience
  • Oracle Supply Chain Management
  • 3-4 years of systems administration experience

Work Schedule + Benefits

• Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt

• Office Hours: Tuesday-Saturday, 7:00 am - 4:00 pm

• Department needs may call for occasional overtime and occasional travel (10-20% of the time)

• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

• Free meals on work days

• Pay Range is $40.64 - $45.64 per hour, $84,541.00 - $94,931.20 annually.

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time, experienced Maintenance Service Technician covering our San Diego, CA market. The Maintenance Service Technician needs to be HVAC certified, and will work for the Service department.

  • Maintenance and repair of all In-N-Out Burger restaurant equipment – Cooking equipment, A/C units, refrigeration, plumbing, light carpentry, door, shelves, etc.
  • Working well independently with little or no supervision
  • Traveling to the In-N-Out stores in your region at a moment’s notice, in case of emergencies

title: Building & Grounds Specialist
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Building & Grounds Specialist in our Lathrop, CA office. The Building & Grounds Specialist will be responsible for planning and executing multiple time sensitive exterior facility maintenance and repair projects, as an individual contributor and using outside subcontractors.  

General Responsibilities

  • Oversee maintenance projects, such as annual asphalt parking lot seal coating and striping programs, asphalt repairs, pot holes, truncated dome repair, ADA issues, crack chasing, and concrete repairs
  • Execute multiple time sensitive construction projects using outside vendors
  • Read and follow blueprints and specifications
  • Familiar with contract estimating, job costing, and scheduling
  • Ability to develop and maintain strong vendor and interdepartmental relationships

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Exempt
  • Alternating Office Hours in Lathrop, CA, which could include Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm or nighttime hours
  • 50% travel throughout California, Oregon, Washington, and Nevada.
  • Night and weekend availability required as necessary
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
  • Pay Range is $104,500-120,000 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors

Qualifications

  • Must have at least three (3) years experience in maintaining asphalt and concrete parking lots
  • Experience with supporting independent contractors (vendors) & Project Supervisors to achieve the desired parking lot maintenance in a timely manner
  • Experience with: asphalt maintenance products, grading, drainage, soils, concrete, asphalt, waterproofing
  • Trade skills: excavation, fine grading, plumbing, electrical, concrete finishing
  • Experience using Blue Beam and CAD is desired (training available)  
  • Strong knowledge of concrete and asphalt materials 
  • Must possess strong negotiation skills and the ability to read and interpret construction and engineering drawings
  • Must be a strong communicator; possess excellent telephone skills
  • Proficient in Outlook, Excel, Word

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Idaho, Washington, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Senior Talent Acquisition Partner based in our Irvine, CA location*. Reporting to the Talent Acquisition Supervisor, this role will play a critical part in shaping strategic hiring initiatives. The Senior TAP will act as a trusted advisor to hiring managers, drive innovative sourcing strategies, and elevate the overall recruitment experience for both candidates and internal stakeholders. 

*This position is full-time, in-office only. 

General Responsibilities
Strategic Talent Partnership 
  • Build strong consultative relationships with hiring managers and senior leadership to develop proactive hiring strategies. 
  • Lead intake meetings to define hiring needs, develop sourcing strategies, and establish clear timelines. 
  • Act as a subject matter expert, advising stakeholders on market trends, talent availability, compensation insights, and best practices for talent selection and retention. 
  • Provide hiring managers with data-driven recommendations to ensure alignment with business objectives. 
Full-Cycle Recruiting & Candidate Experience 
  • Manage end-to-end recruitment for entry-to-senior level roles, ensuring a smooth and efficient hiring process. 
  • Proactively source passive candidates through LinkedIn, ATS, Boolean queries, industry networking, and targeted outreach. 
  • Build and maintain pipelines of talent for future hiring needs. 
  • Conduct in-depth screenings and interviews to assess technical skills, competencies, and cultural fit. 
  • Own the candidate experience, ensuring a seamless and positive journey from application to onboarding. 
Talent Market Expertise & Employer Branding 
  • Identify and implement innovative sourcing strategies to attract top talent in competitive markets. 
  • Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with vocational schools, professional associations, and community organizations. 
  • Represent In-N-Out Burger as an employer of choice at industry events, job fairs, networking opportunities, and speaking engagements. 
  • Leverage market intelligence to provide insights on compensation trends, hiring challenges, and industry best practices. 
Process Improvement & Collaboration 
  • Continuously evaluate and optimize recruitment processes to drive efficiency and effectiveness. 
  • Mentor and provide guidance to junior team members, sharing best practices and fostering a culture of continuous learning. 
  • Partner with internal stakeholders such as Compensation, Payroll, and HR leadership to drive alignment on offers, hiring decisions, and workforce planning. 
  • Lead and contribute to special projects related to recruitment operations, employer branding, candidate engagement, and technology enhancements.

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time, Salary, Exempt
  • Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm
  • Occasional travel required to corporate offices and satellite locations in CA and TN, depending on business needs. 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance 
  • Salary Range is $103,500 - $130,000 annually 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred, but not required. 
  • 5+ years of full-cycle recruiting experience, with at least 2 years in a strategic talent advisory role. 
  • This is an in-house recruiting role, strong sourcing and relationship management skills are required, but experience in agency recruiting or executive search is a plus 
  • Proven ability to build relationships at all levels, influence hiring decisions, and drive results. 
  • Strong sourcing expertise with experience utilizing LinkedIn Recruiter, Boolean search, and passive talent outreach. 
  • Ability to analyze hiring trends and market data to drive hiring strategies. 
  • Experience managing multiple high-priority searches with a sense of urgency in a fast-paced environment. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a strong ability to engage and influence stakeholders. 
  • Strong project management and problem-solving skills. 

Work Location Details
In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948.

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger.


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger
In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado, Washington, Idaho, and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948. We have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: De-Boning Room General Helper
description_html:
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Meat Department General Helper in our Lathrop, CA  warehouse.  The minimum starting pay for this position is $23.00/hourly.

General Responsibilities
  • Ensure that all food product and food safety obligations are met
  • Efficiently move beef to the butchers’ table
  • Track Chuck inventory
  • Trim meat as necessary
  • Assist in disassembling all equipment after production has ended each day
  • Assisting in other meat department positions when necessary
Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Pay Range: $23.00-25.50 per hour            
    • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Hours: 6:00 a.m. to 2:30 p.m.; some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
Job Requirements:
  • High school diploma or GED
  • A minimum of one (1) year experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience
  • Experience with food line work; repetitive line work
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.

title: Company Store Retail Clerk - Full-Time
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We currently have an excellent opportunity for a Full-Time Retail Clerk based in our Las Vegas In-N-Out Burger Company Store (4838 Dean Martin Dr., Las Vegas, NV 89103). The Retail Clerk will also be responsible for covering shifts at our Linq location (3545 Las Vegas Blvd., 89109). This person will be responsible for obtaining or receiving merchandise, accepting payments, and providing excellent customer service in the retail store. 

General Responsibilities
  • Greet and assist our walk-in customers in our Las Vegas Company Stores
  • Demonstrate a positive personality; strong commitment to helping In-N-Out customers and associates
  • Possess outstanding customer service skills
  • Obtain merchandise requested by customer, or receive merchandise selected by customer
  • Stock shelves, counters or tables with merchandise
  • Answer customer questions about merchandise and offer suggestions
  • Keep the store and showroom clean and orderly
  • Cashier and stock merchandise in the store
  • Place and verify orders to restock the storage room
  • Ensure inventory levels are correctly maintained and stored in the correct locations
  • Effectively communicate with your fellow team members; excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Maintain knowledge of current sales and promotions, policies regarding payment and exchanges, and recognize security risks and thefts
  • Assist with other projects as assigned by the Merchandise Manager

Work Schedule + Benefits
  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt) 
  • Full Time hours:  40 hours per week 
  • Schedule/Shifts: 7 days availability anywhere from 9:00am to 12:00am
  • Will be rotating between two store locations: Dean Martin and Linq Company Stores
Job Requirements:
  • Min 2 years of customers service experience 
  • Strong customer service skills required
  • Strong computer and typing skills; Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office software, including Word, Excel and Outlook
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through on assignments with minimal direction and supervision
  • Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with team
  • Valid Nevada Driver's License

title: Maintenance Supervisor - Meat
description_html:
Come join our Maintenance family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time experienced Maintenance Supervisor to lead the direct upkeep and reliability of critical production equipment and plant facilities at our Lathrop Meat Facility. The role focuses on the Provisur Novamax 660 patty forming system while extending to supporting systems including hot water & compressed air generation, crate wash tunnels, conveyor networks, CHAD cabinet, and VAT dumpers. The supervisor will direct a small team of technicians, enforce food-safety compliance and drive preventive/predictive maintenance programs to minimize downtime.

Key Responsibilities

Equipment Leadership

  • Oversee daily PM, troubleshooting, and repair of Provisur Novamax 660 patty formers (hydraulics, PLC controls, forming plates, knockout systems).
  • Maintain hot water heaters, low- and high-pressure pumps, and distribution loops for sanitation and process needs.
  • Manage crate wash systems (chemical dosing, high-pressure nozzles, drying zones).
  • Ensure conveyor belts, rollers, motors, and alignment meet USDA sanitary standards.
  • Service VAT dumpers, hydraulic lifts, and tipping mechanisms.

Team Supervision

  • Lead, train, and schedule 4–6 maintenance technicians across shifts.
  • Conduct performance reviews, safety training, and skill-gap development.
  • Coordinate with production supervisors for scheduled downtime windows.

Reliability & Compliance

  • Develop and execute preventive/predictive maintenance plans (CMMS ).
  • Maintain spare parts inventory for all systems.
  • Enforce LOTO, confined-space, hot-work, and arc-flash protocols.
  • Document repairs and root-cause analysis in compliance with USDA regulations.

Facilities Support

  • Oversee general plant utilities (compressed air, HVAC, lighting, drains).
  • Respond to emergency breakdowns.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (exempt)
  • Pay Range: is $115k to 125k- annually, plus bonus
    • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • Hours: 5:30am to 2:30pm (willing to be flexible), Some overtime as needed
  • 5 days per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off; Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of industrial maintenance experience in food or beverage manufacturing; required (protein processing preferred).
  • 5+ years in a supervisory or lead technician role; required.
  • Proven direct expertise with Provisur Novamax-series patty formers (or equivalent high-speed forming technology such as Formax, Koppens, or Marel); required.
  • Strong electrical troubleshooting skills (480V 3-phase, VFDs, PLC I/O checks – Allen-Bradley or Siemens): required.
  • Proficiency in mechanical systems: bearings, chains, pneumatics, hydraulics, sanitary welding (stainless steel TIG); required.
  • Familiarity with CMMS and spare-parts management; required.
  • Ability to read P&IDs, electrical schematics, and OEM manuals; Required
  • Ammonia refrigeration experience (operator level or familiarity with PSM/RMP programs) – not required but a plus.
  • Certification in predictive technologies (vibration, ultrasound, thermography); preferred.
  • Associate’s degree in industrial maintenance, Mechatronics, or related field OR equivalent military/technical training + experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree a plus but not required.

Physical & Environmental Demands

  • Work in cold (34–38 °F forming rooms) and wet environments.
  • Lift up to 60 lbs.; climb ladders; work at heights; enter confined spaces.
  • Wear PPE (hard hat, hearing protection, cut-resistant gloves).
ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Colorado and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Associate Relations (HR Generalist)
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Associate Relations Partner based in Irvine, CA ! The Human Resources Generalist will report to the Associate Relations Supervisor in the Human Resources department.

*This role is based full time in office.

General Responsibilities

  • Act as the primary point of contact for HR inquiries, managing a high volume of incoming phone calls. This includes engaging with Store Associates, Store Management, Support Center employees, and, occasionally, the General Public on a diverse range of HR topics.
  • Provide a front-line resource for Associate Relations matters, addressing complaints and allegations with professionalism and care.
  • Responsible for writing a high volume of supporting documents, including corrective actions, memorandums, physician assessments, etc.
  • Schedule and conduct investigation meetings and interviews with current Associates as requested.
  • Consistently follow up on all Associate issues and concerns as assigned.
  • Communicate Company policies, procedures, and guidelines effectively to all Associates.
  • Identify violations of Company policies, procedures, and guidelines swiftly and accurately.
  • Assist the HR Business Partner team by creating reports and collecting information to support investigations.
  • Support the HR Business Partner team and other department leaders with projects and assignments as required.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours in Irvine: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. -5:00 p.m.
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Hourly Pay Range: $33.25-$38.00
  • The above represents the expected hourly range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Excellent Benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSAs, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Communication, or a related field; HR certifications are a plus.
  • At least 2 years of experience in Human Resources, with broad exposure to various HR functions.
  • 2+ years of experience managing employee relations, conducting end-to end investigations, and providing guidance on employment-related matters.
  • Strong knowledge of state and federal labor laws and regulations, with demonstrated ability to apply this knowledge effectively across all levels of the organization.
  • Proven ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, and make well-informed decisions.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including presentation and interpersonal abilities.
  • Creative problem-solving skills with excellent organizational and time management capabilities.
  • Proficient in MS Office applications, with expertise in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Bilingual in Spanish is a plus.

Work Location Details 

In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Supply Chain Project Manager I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

This position will report to the Supply Chain PMO Manager and will be responsible for project managing all activities related to assigned projects or program. This role is responsible for planning, organizing, executing, and overseeing projects to ensure they are completed on time, within budget, and to the required INO standards, while also managing resources, stakeholders, and risks. This role is responsible for managing and ensuring that critical meetings are scheduled in collaboration with Administrative Support Associates, and conflicts are proactively resolved. This role will also help develop materials and designs for presentations for Supply Chain teams.

Please note that this is a full-time in-office position.


General Responsibilities

• Plan and organize larger scope projects from their start to completion, including creating & maintaining any required Project Execution documents

• Responsible for coordinating/leading meetings, updating the project’s progress using various mediums (email, Slack, Asana, Teams, etc.), and prioritizing work based on the customer’s needs

• Help develop rollout materials and design presentations for update meetings/trainings with the Supply Chain Team and customers

• Communicate any issues, roadblocks, or scope creep to necessary parties

• Understand project’s timeline, resources, and scope from the project’s kick-off

• Responsible for managing tasks and communicating effectively to all members of the project until it reaches the support phase

• Retrieve data from a variety of sources to identify outcomes and opportunities


Work Schedule + Benefits

• Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt

• Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 am-5:00 pm

• Department needs may call for occasional overtime

• Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

• Free meals on work days

• Pay Range is $36.82 -$38.50 per hour

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.


Qualifications

• Bachelor’s in Supply Chain, Business Administration or Operations (Required)

• 5+ years Project Management (Required)

• Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills

• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels of the organization

• Possesses the ability to quickly learn and understand the fundamentals of In-N-Out’s Supply Chain infrastructure & applications


ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, and Colorado. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well-trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

  • Identify violations of Company policies, procedures, and guidelines swiftly and accurately.
  • Assist the HR Business Partner team by creating reports and collecting information to support investigations.
  • Support the HR Business Partner team and other department leaders with projects and assignments as required.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Office Hours in Irvine: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. -5:00 p.m.
  • Department needs may call for occasional overtime
  • Hourly Pay Range: $33.25-$38.00
  • The above represents the expected hourly range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Excellent Benefits to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSAs, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Communication, or a related field; HR certifications are a plus.
  • At least 2 years of experience in Human Resources, with broad exposure to various HR functions.
  • 2+ years of experience managing employee relations, conducting end-to end investigations, and providing guidance on employment-related matters.
  • Strong knowledge of state and federal labor laws and regulations, with demonstrated ability to apply this knowledge effectively across all levels of the organization.
  • Proven ability to work independently, exercise sound judgment, and make well-informed decisions.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including presentation and interpersonal abilities.
  • Creative problem-solving skills with excellent organizational and time management capabilities.
  • Proficient in MS Office applications, with expertise in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
  • Bilingual in Spanish is a plus.

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Driver I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Delivery Driver in our Draper, UT warehouse. The Delivery Driver will be based out of our Draper warehouse, and will be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product to our In-N-Out Burger restaurant locations and satellite warehouses. 

About Our Fleet:

  • 389 Peterbilt Classic Day Cabs
  • Quiet Reefer (Carrier brand)
  • 13-speed transmission/Eaton
General Responsibilities

  • Operate company truck to provide daily deliveries to In-N-Out Burger restaurants
  • Be responsible for the delivery and rotation of product
  • Ensure that our customers receive only the freshest, highest quality ingredients
  • Operate an electric pallet jack, forklift, lift gates, hand trucks
  • Move large product racks
  • Establish and maintain excellent customer service relationships
  • Complete some warehouse duties such as loading/unloading trucks, and order pulling for the store deliveries
  • Perform all duties with pride; Work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation
Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt
  • Hours: 12am – 10:30 am 
  • Four (4) nights per week; Rotating Schedule
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance
  • Free meals on work days 
  • Pay: $39.00 per hour (Starting)

Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • A minimum of two (2) years experience as a CDL holder delivery driver (required)
  • Experience with direct store or restaurant delivery experience (preferred)
  • Must be comfortable working and driving in inclement weather
  • Ability to lift 60-75 lbs. on a continuous basis
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Strong initiative; Ability to work independently and follow through safely and accurately on assignments with minimal supervision
  • Valid Class A driver’s license (required) with a clean driving record
  • Must be able pass a company administered driving test and be able to properly operate a 10-speed and 13-speed transmission
  • Must be able to drive a manual transmission
 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Colorado and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon

title: Warehouse Worker
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Warehouse Worker in our Colorado Springs, CO warehouse.  The Warehouse Worker will pull orders, prepare orders for delivery, receive and process warehouse products; may perform other warehouse functions as needed.

General Responsibilities

  • Order pulling on a routine basis: Moving food items from storage areas to the shipping pallet
  • Physically pull orders from shelves and load them onto trucks
  • Responsible for keeping products separated, organized and in good rotation
  • Transporting packed items onto the shipping pallet; load onto the delivery truck
  • Perform any combination of receiving, storing and distributing tasks to assist in the distribution of product
  • Pulling and preparing store product orders using an electric riding pallet jack, forklift, and hand-truck for delivery
  • Maintain accurate inventory

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Hours: 11:00am – 9:30pm (Sun-Wed) 
  • (4) days per week, set schedule (Subject to change)
  • Weekend and holiday availability required; Overtime as necessary
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) Plan
  • Free meals on work days
  • Pay Range is $22.75-24.50 per hour 
    The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Job Requirements

  • High school diploma or GED (required)
  • Valid Colorado Driver's License
  • 1-2 years warehouse experience, or Order Puller experience (preferred)
  • 1-2 years experience working in a meat facility, food processing plant, or similar warehouse experience (preferred)
  • Exceptional oral and written communication skills
  • Dependable and Reliable; Excellent time management skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to interact with all levels of management
  • Physical Demands/Requirements
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 60-75 lbs.
  • Ability to work with heavy machinery
  • Experience using an electric riding pallet jack, forklift, and hand-truck for delivery (preferred)

 

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Colorado and Washington. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Butcher
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!  

We have an excellent opportunity for a Full-Time Butcher in our Lathrop, CA Meat Department. 

General Responsibilities:

  • De-boning arm chucks, removing excess fat, gristle and bone to comply with In-N-Out standards. 
  • Observes for any imperfections, such as bruises and foreign matters and reports any findings. 
  • Final inspection of all products before they are sent for processing 
  • Clean and maintain tools and equipment 

Work Schedule + Benefits:

  • Full-time, Non-Exempt 
  • Pay Range: $25.00 to $28.00/hourly + Monthly Butcher Incentive
    •  The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your experience and other job-related factors
  • This position is also eligible to earn a Butcher Incentive based on production levels
  • Rotating Schedule, 6am-2:30pm, Holiday and Weekend availability required, overtime as needed 
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance

Job Requirements:

  • Have a minimum of 3-5 years of experience as a Butcher in a meat processing facility
  • Be able to demonstrate fast pace de-boning skills
  • Knife sharping skills 
  • Performing all duties with pride and craftsmanship and to work well in an atmosphere of teamwork and cooperation while adhering to all safety and sanitation standards
  • High school diploma or GED

Physical Demands/Requirements:

  • Must be able to demonstrate fast pace de-boning skills
  • Ability to move freely in and around obstacles common in the meat production room and the ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs 
  • Ability to withstand prolonged work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit

title: Plumber
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Plumber to cover the In-N-Out Burger stores in Northern California, Northern Nevada, Oregon, Utah, Colorado, and Idaho. The Plumber is based out of the Lathrop, CA warehouse, and will be responsible for troubleshooting, servicing, and repairing Plumber-related issues at the In-N-Out Burger restaurants.

General Responsibilities

• Install, maintain, and repair plumbing systems and fixtures for In-N-Out Burger restaurants throughout the company

• Perform sewer repairs

• Perform gas and water line repairs

• Locate and repair issues with water supply lines, such as leaks, etc.

• Troubleshoot, service, and complete repairs to plumbing systems of current restaurants

• Repair or replace broken drainage lines, clogged drains, faucets, etc.

• Use augers, snakes, cameras, remodels and new system installations

• Maintain the cleanliness of their work area

Work Schedule + Benefits

• Full-time, Hourly, Non-Exempt

  • Pay Range for Beginner Plumber is $28.44 - $32.00 per hour
  • Pay Range Intermediate Plumber is $31.50 - $35.00 per hour

The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition.  Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.

• 4 nights per week, 10-hour days

• Hours: Graveyard shift: 12:00 a.m. to 10:30 a.m.; overtime as needed

• Weekend and holiday availability required

• Travel: 40-50% of the time Plumbers will be out of town or out of state; Travel required to the states where In-N-Out Burger operates

• Excellent full-time Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Profit Sharing Plan and 401(k) retirement Plan

Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of plumbing repair and remodel experience required.
  • Professional plumbing experience in residential or commercial service and repair preferred.
  • Solid understanding of water distribution and disposal systems in commercial, industrial, or restaurant buildings preferred.
  • Extensive travel schedule – must be able to travel out of town/out of state for up to 8 days at a time
  • A Valid California Driver's License
  • Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
  • Good physical condition and strength with the ability to work in awkward spaces
  • Familiarity with Uniform Plumbing Codes
  • Strong customer service orientation; Friendly
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills; Be able to interact with all levels of management and outside organizations to represent the company in a positive and professional manner

title: Sanitation Technician I
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger! 

We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Night Sanitation Technician in our Lathrop, CA warehouse.  The Sanitation Technician will work evening shifts in the Meat processing department. 

General Responsibilities

  • Be directly responsible for cleaning and sanitizing the commissary plant equipment
  • Clean large food processing equipment; Chemicals will be used during the sanitation process
  • Responsible for operation of sanitation equipment such as the pressure washer
  • Wash and sanitize all commissary plant property using proper cleaning procedures
  • Clean meat crates and blue plastic pallets/crates
  • Clean and sanitize food processing equipment, roof, fans, ceilings, walls and floors using specific procedures as directed
  • Use all proper cleaning procedures so that it meets with both In-N-Out Burger and USDA standards
  • Assist in reassembling equipment when necessary
  • Monitor and document chemical concentrations to ensure proper cleaning of equipment
  • Follow all safety policies and procedures at all times

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time position, Hourly (non-exempt)
  • Pay Range: $24.25-$25.00 per hour               
    • The above represents the expected pay range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.
  • Hours: 4:00 p.m. to 12:30 a.m.; some overtime as needed (start times may vary)
  • 5 nights per week, rotating schedule and alternating days off
  • Weekend and holiday availability required
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans and Pet Insurance


Job Requirements:

  • High school diploma or GED
  • One (1) year experience working in a meat facility or similar responsibilities
  • One (1) year Sanitation or Janitorial experience, preferably in a food processing plant
  • Ability to read chemical labels and follow safe handling procedures for all chemicals used in cleaning activities

Physical Demands/Requirements

  • Ability to lift a minimum of 70 lbs.
  • Ability to climb tall ladders and not be afraid of heights
  • Ability to withstand varied environmental conditions, such as cold and heat, extreme wet, within closed surroundings
  • Will work in an environment that is wet, damp, and humid; will undergo temperature changes from hot to cold
  • Will wear rain gear while hosing down equipment
  • Exposure to chemical cleaning solution (with protective gear)
  • Production rooms are warm when cleaning them: 70-80 degrees
  • Occasional work assignments in temperatures as low as 34 degrees Fahrenheit
  • Position requires frequent lifting, standing, reaching, climbing, pulling, stooping, bending, and kneeling
  • Maintain constant mental focus and constantly be aware of surroundings

ABOUT In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas, Oregon, Idaho, Washington, Colorado and Tennessee. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy – serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.

title: Senior HR Business Partner
description_html:
Come join our family at In-N-Out Burger!
   
We have an excellent opportunity for a full-time Senior Human Resources Business Partner based in our Irvine, CA office! 

The Senior Human Resources Business Partner (Sr. HRBP) reports to the Regional HR Manager and plays a pivotal role in providing strategic HR support to our Stores and highly complex Corporate Departments. This position serves as a trusted advisor in supporting organizational goals and objectives, workforce planning and performance management. The Senior HRBP also leads and supports key HR projects and initiatives, demonstrating advanced expertise in HR disciplines and competencies.

General Responsibilities

  • Serve as a trusted advisor to assigned Stores, highly complex Support Departments, and business leaders, addressing medium- to complex employee relations issues.
  • Make strategic management recommendations impacting team performance and coach managers to keep employees accountable for meeting goals.
  • Conduct regular meetings with team leaders to understand talent requirements and business goals. Drive talent review and assessments by facilitating succession and performance calibration sessions.
  • Coach business leaders on the appropriate tools and resources for team development, championing mentorship programs, leadership development, and training.
  • Prepare internal equity analysis and provide recommendations for Support leaders addressing outcomes related to job offers, promotions, transfers, terminations, and strategic management decisions impacting team performance.
  • Work in partnership with other HR functions to contribute to key HR projects, including process workflows, change management, and workforce planning.
  • Drive the strategy and lead larger projects contributing to multiple areas of the organization, such as the annual performance review process.
  • Develop insights from people data (engagement surveys, exit interviews, etc.) to inform talent acquisition, development, and retention strategies.
  • Provide ongoing development, training, and mentorship for HR team members.

Work Schedule + Benefits

  • Full-time, Exempt
  • Office Hours in Irvine, CA: Monday-Friday, 8AM - 5 PM or a 9/80 compressed workweek with core hours from 8AM-6PM, with every other Monday or Friday off.
  • Occasional Saturday shifts (8 AM- 5 PM) required (approximately 5 per year).
  • Some scheduling flexibility is required for off-site meetings and travel to satellite offices.
  • Excellent Benefits, to include Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, FSA’s, 401(k)/Profit Sharing Plan, Adoption Assistance, Education Reimbursement, Supplemental Health Plans, and Pet Insurance
  • Pay Range: $115,000-$140,000/annually + Bonus Potential
  • The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we will consider your experience and other job-related factors.

Qualifications

  • BA/BS degree in a relevant field or equivalent years of HR experience; a Master’s degree in human resources or a related field is a plus.
  • 8+ years of Human Resources experience, with a background in providing HR support to both corporate and field-based teams. 
  • 5+ years of proven experience as a strategic HRBP with experience in talent development, succession planning, compensation, performance management, and workforce planning.
  • Demonstrated ability to coach business leaders using effective communication, active listening, and motivational techniques for team development.
  • Striving for excellence and aspirational in talent management initiatives.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively with other HR functions and departments, demonstrating strong interpersonal skills and adaptability in various project environments.
  • Demonstrated project management skills, including planning, execution, and monitoring, with the ability to drive the strategy and lead projects contributing to organizational goals.
  • Ability to influence project outcomes and gain support from key stakeholders.
  • Demonstrates a bias for action and a driven approach to achieving strategic goals.
  • Experience in providing ongoing development, training, and mentorship to HR team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth within the team.

Work Location Details 


In-N-Out Burger plans to bring its west coast headquarters team back together under one roof by the end of 2029. After maintaining two Southern California office locations for many years, the company will permanently close its Irvine office in 2029 and once again headquarter the company’s western territory solely in Baldwin Park, California, where the company was founded in 1948. 

Newly hired Associates in Irvine will be eligible to participate in the group move to Tennessee with relocation assistance or work from our western headquarters in Baldwin Park, CA, upon its opening in 2029. We are sharing this information early so candidates can make informed decisions while considering a career with In-N-Out Burger

About In-N-Out Burger

In-N-Out Burger was founded in 1948 by Harry and Esther Snyder in Baldwin Park, California, and remains privately owned and operated. Under the direction of the Snyder family, the company has opened restaurants throughout California, Nevada, Arizona, Utah, Texas and Oregon, Colorado and Idaho. In-N-Out Burger’s menu has remained the same since 1948, and we have maintained a simple philosophy - serve only the highest quality product, prepare it in a clean and sparkling environment, and serve it in a warm and friendly manner. We have built a reputation for fresh, made-to-order foods prepared and served by friendly, well trained Associates.

In-N-Out Burger offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefit package. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer by choice. Should there be a need, In-N-Out Burger will provide a reasonable accommodation to complete the interview process upon request.
